page.title: 01NATURAL HISTORY.LLANSANNAN
page.content: This is an area of rolling hills and river-formed valleys used for rough grazing,mixed-farming and forestry.It is a region of natural beauty with a wealth of local history and many local historians. The profusion of lane verges provide a wealthy selection of wild flowers,whilst the hedges and forests give shelter to a wide variety of birds.Wild ponies,foxes and a further selection of birds may be found amongst the lakes and moorland areas of the nearby Hiraethog uplands.All types of indigenous hawks and owls are present in the area;curlews and plovers arrive in the spring.The following have been observed in 1985:-Buzzard,Sparrowhawk,Grouse,Pheas ant,Woodcock,Carrion Crow and the usual profusion of garden birds. .
